free_text.Learning outcomes: Introduce students to the magnetic and electronic properties of nanostructures [br/]
free_text.Content: 1) Epitaxial growth of metallic 2D nanostructures (2h):[br/]	a.	Cluster nucleation and aggregation: the importance of kinetics[br/]	b.	Controlling shape and composition of 2D clusters grown by self assembly methods[br/]2)	Magnetism at the nanoscale (4h):[br/]	a.	Orbital and spin magnetic moment: from single atoms to 3D clusters[br/]	b.	Surface supported nanostructures: the effect of the supporting substrate on the cluster magnetic properties[br/]	c.	Superparamagnetic limit in magnetic data storage[br/]3)	Electronics vs. spintronics (8h):[br/]	a.	2D electron gas at heterogeneous semiconductor interfaces[br/]	b.	Single electron transistor[br/]	c. 	A new 2D material: the electronic properties of graphene[br/]	d.	Spin transport: spin valve, GMR and TMR[br/]	e.	Observing the magnetism of a single atom with Scanning tunnelling microscope[br/]4)	Semiconductor Materials for Photonics (2h)[br/]	a.	Physical properties[br/]	b.	Applications[br/]5)	Fabrication and Structural Properties of quantum dots (4h)[br/]	a.	Epitaxial growth (Stranski-Krastanov and pyramidal quantum dots)[br/]	b.	Chemically synthesized nanoparticles (CdSe quantum dots)[br/]6)	Electronic Properties of quantum dots (8h)[br/]	a.	Quantum confinement effects (from 2D to 0D)[br/]	b.	Electronic states: excitonic complexes (excitons, biexcitons, trions), dipole moment (Stark effect)[br/]	c.	Exciton-phonon interactions (temperature dependent exciton linewidth), phonon wings, polaron complexes [br/]	d.	Light-matter interaction in quantum dots  (Purcell effect and strong-light-matter coupling) [br/]
free_text.Keywords: electronic structure, transport, magnetism, semiconductors, quantum dots[br/]
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Basic condensed matter physics and quantum physics[br/]
